What we know so far about NHL Seattle

February 10, 2020 - Caleb Wetherell


Source: New Arena at Seattle Center

Contents


  • What is the team name for NHL Seattle?
  • When is the first NHL Seattle game?
  • Where will NHL Seattle play?
  • When is the expansion draft?
  • Where is the practice facility?
  • What do we know about the staff?
  • Does Seattle have the fanbase to support NHL Seattle?


What is the team name for NHL Seattle?

According to the rumor mill, the most likely mascot will be a ‘Kraken’, which is a sea monster of gigantic size in Scandinavian folklore. Seattle Times ran a competition to determine what the locals would like to see, and Kraken lost in the first round to Steelheads in the first round!


So, why do we think the mascot will be Kraken? In an interview on Sirius XM’s NHL Network Radio, John Hoven reported that he heard the name would be ‘Kraken’ and that he was ‘surprised’ at the choice. Hoven is the editor of Mayors Manor, a blog dedicated to the Los Angeles Kings. Following the rumor, SBNation graced us with some logos and uniform concepts. My personal favorite is the tentacle shaped ‘S’:



Following the viral explosion of ‘Kraken’ being selected, NHL Seattle sent a tweet seemingly narrowing down the options, but confirming none of them:


While we’re aware of some fishy rumors surrounding our team name, please rest assured we’re doing our due diligence by scouring the depths of the ocean, the tallest mountains, and the densest parts of the forest to find the right name for our great, green city.

— NHL Seattle (@NHLSeattle_) January 29, 2020


It’s still unclear what the mascot will be for NHL Seattle, but Kraken is certainly a front runner.
